complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Break down the initialization process into: (1) directory structure creation, (2) git repository setup, (3) renv environment initialization, (4) .gitignore and README creation, (5) R version and package locking, (6) config.yaml and data_schema.json template preparation.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: This task is foundational but follows well-established best practices for reproducible R projects, including project-oriented workflows, version control, and environment management[1][2]. Each step is discrete and can be independently verified, but the overall process is straightforward for experienced R users.

complexityAnalysis.taskTitle: Migrate and Modularize Existing Notebook Code
complexityAnalysis.expansionPrompt: Expand by module: (1) io.R, (2) qc.R, (3) normalize.R, (4) seedmap.R, (5) stats.R, (6) cluster.R, (7) targets.R/plots.R. For each, include code migration, API definition, roxygen2 documentation, invariant enforcement, and unit testing.
complexityAnalysis.reasoning: Refactoring notebook code into modular, pure R scripts with strict APIs and documentation is moderately complex, requiring careful separation of concerns, removal of side effects, and adherence to best practices for maintainability and testability[3].
